intro: Chorizanthe californica var. suksdorfii, commonly known as the Suksdorf's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland habitats. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
